title: U.S. Holds On to Measles-Elimination Status
text:
The U.S. has retained its measles-elimination status, despite a nearly yearlong outbreak in New York state that put that designation at risk, the Department of Health and Human Services confirmed Friday.

The announcement follows an announcement Thursday from New York state that its outbreak that began Oct. 1, 2018 had ended. As a result, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said Thursday, the nation had likely held on to the status that it gained in 2000 after years of public health efforts to expand vaccination...
description: The U.S. has retained its measles-elimination status, despite a nearly yearlong outbreak in New York state that put that designation at risk, the Department of Health and Human Services confirmed.
